MathJax in Jekyll kramdown

Rod Kennedy

Getting MathJax to play nice with Jekyll/Kramdown needs a bit of tinkering

is obtained by

$$
\begin{align}
  x &= y \\
  z &= p
\end{align}
\begin{equation}
\label{eqn:shbe}
	H(\theta,\phi;k) = \sum_{p=1}^{\infty} \gamma_{p}\,\varGamma_{p}(\theta,\phi;k)
\end{equation}
$$
